info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Berks County through 1130 PM EDT... At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Donaldson to near Annville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamburg, Womelsdorf, Bernville and Strausstown. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
